Key Match Events: Andrew Wiggins scored 18 of his team-high 24 points in the third quarter
Lindy Waters III began the second quarter by scoring eight straight points
Jonathan Kuminga landed awkwardly on his right ankle and limped straight to the locker room
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Warriors improved to 10-8 at home on the season and have won two of their last three games played at Chase Center and three of their last four games overall
The Warriors are winners of two-straight games for the first time since 11/20-11/22
Tonight marked the Warriors’ league-high tying 22nd Clutch Game on the season
Others: The Warriors will host the Sacramento Kings on the second night of a back-to-back at Chase Center on Sunday
The teams meet for the fourth and final time on April 1 at Memphis
Tonight marked the first time since 2015 (11/27 at PHX, 57.9% and 11/28 vs. SAC, 53.3%) the Warriors have recorded consecutive games making at least 53% of their attempts from the 3-point line
The Warriors deployed their 19th unique starting lineup of the season
Andrew Wiggins scored a game-high 24 points, his 10th 20-point game of the season
Draymond Green made three 3-pointers, the seventh time he’s recorded three-or-more 3-pointers in a game this season
Trayce Jackson-Davis has now scored 10-or-more points in seven of his last eight games
Buddy Hield made his seventh start of the season, recording 14 points, his 19th game scoring in double figures this season
Dennis Schröder tallied 17 points, his highest scoring output as a Warrior
Lindy Waters III made a season-high tying four threes en route to his seventh game of double-figure scoring on the season
Pat Spencer recorded his first-career block
Jonathan Kuminga excited the game with 2:27 to play in the second quarter and did not return due to a sprained right ankle
